gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ThreeD
Class DetectorSceneBase

java.lang.Object
  SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Node
      SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Group
          gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ThreeD.DetectorSceneBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGL_Renderable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DetectorScene, DetectorSceneFrames
public class DetectorSceneBase
extends Group

This base class is used to draw a 3D scene consisting of detector groups. Each Detector is represented by two arrays: an array of points and an array of bounds information for each point. Every detector point will be drawn as solid boxes using the physical information stored in the bounds array. The detectors are assigned the given ids and each pixel within a detector will assume its index within the points array as its id. The volume bounding box is calculated as each detector is added, and the center is assumed to be at the origin, <0,0,0>. Once all detectors are added, makeCamera can be called to create a camera that will view the volume from an adjusted distance along away from the scene. In addition, addSceneCircle will encompose the volume with a 2d circle, and addLineAxes will draw coordinate axes at the center of the scene. The object also stores a collection of currently selected pixels. The user may add/remove pixels from the set to specify whether they have been selected or not. The selected pixels can then be colored with a given color.

Constructor Detail

DetectorSceneBase

public DetectorSceneBase()
Constructor. Initalizes the base scene. To add objects, use addDetector(). The center is assumed to be at the origin.

Method Detail

addDetector

public void addDetector(int id,
                        int shapeType,
                        IPointList3D point_list,
                        IBoundsList3D bounds_list)
This method adds a detector to the scene. A detector is constructed by giving a list of points to represent the pixels and a list of bound information for each point to define the shape and orientation of the pixel. Entries in point_list and bounds_list should coorrespond, e.g. a point at index 1 in point_list will have its bounds information at index 1 in bounds_list. The bounds list should have equal the number of entries as point_list, and excess indices in bounds_list will be ignored. The volume bounding box is recalculated for each detector added. The center is assumed to be at the origin.

Parameters:
id - Detector id.
shapeType - The type of shape that each pixel will be drawn as. Default is BOX.
point_list - An array of 3D points. Each point represents a pixel of the Detector.
bounds_list - An array of bounds information for each point in point_list. This defines the shape of each pixel.

addSceneCircle

public void addSceneCircle()
This method draws a 2d circle on the horizontal plane running through the volume. The circle should expand past the diameter of the volume to encompose all of the objects.

removeSceneCircle

public void removeSceneCircle()
Removes the circle guide from the scene.

addLineAxes

public void addLineAxes()
This method draws lines to represent the axes of the scene. Red for x-axis, green for y-axis, and blue for z-axis.

removeLineAxes

public void removeLineAxes()
Removes the line axis guide from the scene.

makeCamera

public Camera makeCamera()
This creates a camera based on the bounding box surrounding the scene. It will center the view of the camera to the middle of the scene, place the up position along the z axis and move the camera back along the x axis

Returns:
Camera to be put into JoglPanel

getDiameter

public float getDiameter()
This returns the diameter of volume containing the entire scene

Returns:
The diameter of volume containing entire scene.

setBackgroundColor

public void setBackgroundColor(java.awt.Color background)
This changes the background (glClearColor) to the specified Color object.

Parameters:
background - The color to change the background to.

getFormattedSelectedIDs

public java.lang.String[] getFormattedSelectedIDs()
Return all of the selected pixels in an array of strings. Each string is formatted as follows: "Det Pix " where detector_user_id is an integer representing the id given to the detector when it was added and the pixel_user_id is the index to the pixel within the detector. Each selected pixel has an individual string.

Returns:
An array of formatted strings, one for each selected pixel.

getSelectedItems

public java.util.Vector getSelectedItems()
Return all of the selected pixels as a Vector of SelectListItem objects. Each SelectedListItem is grouped by a single detector and all selected pixels for that detector.

Returns:
A Vector SelectedListItem objects representing all selected pixels.

retainSelectedPixels

public void retainSelectedPixels(int[] det_ids,
                                 int[] pixel_ids)
This will intersect the set of given selected pixels with the current selected pixels. The lists of ids must match in length, where every index represents corresponding ids within the two arrays. Thus, for index i, retain pixel at i that is in detector at i.

Parameters:
det_ids - The detector ids as given when the detector was added.
pixel_ids - The pixel ids within the detector id.

retainSelectedPixels

public void retainSelectedPixels(SelectedListItem[] items)
This will intersect the set of given selected pixels with the current selected pixels.

Parameters:
items - An array of SelectedListItem that contains detector and pixels ids that should be retained.

addSelectedPixel

public void addSelectedPixel(SelectedListItem item)
This method adds the pixels contained within the given item. For each detector id, all of the pixel ids will be added to the set of selected pixels.

Parameters:
item - The item containing detectors with pixel ids that will be added to selection.

addSelectedPixel

public void addSelectedPixel(int detid,
                             int pixelid)
This method adds the pixel found within the specified ids to the set of selected pixels. The first id represents the id number given to the detector when it was added (ie, the user id) and the second id represents the pixels index within that detector.

Parameters:
detid - The detector id number.
pixelid - The pixel id number within the detector.

removeSelectedPixel

public void removeSelectedPixel(SelectedListItem item)
This method removes the pixels contained within the given item. For each detector id, all of the pixel ids will be removed from the set of selected pixels.

Parameters:
item - The item containing detectors with pixel ids that will be removed from selection.

removeSelectedPixel

public void removeSelectedPixel(int detid,
                                int pixelid)
This method removes the pixel found within the specified ids from the set of selected pixels. The first id represents the id number given to the detector when it was added (ie, the user id) and the second id represents the pixels index within that detector.

Parameters:
detid - The detector id number.
pixelid - The pixel id number within the detector.

addSelectedPixel

public void addSelectedPixel(int pickid)
This method adds the pixel node with the given PickID to the set of selected pixels. The PickID is the unique identification number within the scene graph.

Parameters:
pickid - Unique identification number of the Pixel shape.

removeSelectedPixel

public void removeSelectedPixel(int pickid)
This method removes the pixel node with the given PickID from the set of selected pixels. The PickID is the unique identification number within the scene graph.

Parameters:
pickid - Unique identification number of the Pixel shape.

addSelectedDetector

public void addSelectedDetector(int pickid)
This method adds the all pixel nodes contained in the detector group with the given PickID to the set of selected pixels. The PickID is the unique identification number within the scene graph.

Parameters:
pickid - Unique identification number of the detector group.

removeSelectedDetector

public void removeSelectedDetector(int pickid)
This method removes the all pixel nodes contained in the detector group with the given PickID from the set of selected pixels. The PickID is the unique identification number within the scene graph.

Parameters:
pickid - Unique identification number of the detector group.

clearSelected

public void clearSelected()
This method unselects all pixels.

colorSelected

public void colorSelected(java.awt.Color color)
This method colors all the selected pixels with the given color. The change will not be seen until the next call to the Draw method for the jogl panel.

Parameters:
color - The color to apply to selected pixels.

RequestListRebuild

public void RequestListRebuild()
Set the compileDisplayList flag to true, so that the next time the scene is rendered, the display lists will be regenerated.

Render

public void Render(net.java.games.jogl.GLDrawable drawable)
This method renders the scene by first collecting the GL calls into a display list and making a call to that display list once it is compiled.

Specified by:
Render in interface IGL_Renderable
Overrides:
Render in class Group
Parameters:
drawable - The drawable on which the object is to be rendered.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Main program that constructs an instance of the scene and displays it in 3D for testing purposes.
